comments.body: Favorite Casino: Several Wagered amount: $My secretProfit: ZeroMost played games: Slots & SportsBiggest win : $3500Biggest loss in one game: $1000Average bet size: $0.20I do not think people want other people to know what their private financial matters are ....so you will get responses like the above. comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on September 24, 2022, 12:19:49 PMFavorite Casino: Several Wagered amount: $My secretProfit: ZeroMost played games: Slots & SportsBiggest win : $3500Biggest loss in one game: $1000Average bet size: $0.20I do not think people want other people to know what their private financial matters are ....so you will get responses like the above. Will you ask people in a Brick n Mortar casino this question, if you are standing face to face with them? I definitely agree with this. Even though I will show the biggest amount I won and biggest amount I lose is that I also won't show the total amount wagered. If someone ask me that question face to face then I would only say that I lose and won but never tell the exact amount as you might become a target a thief if you told them about it. I think it wouldn't be much different even if it is online.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Favorite Casino: None really, I play wherever I think is good from time to time. Wagered amount: I'd say secret but I actually have no idea since I've played on multiple sites. Profit: Never been rich because of gambling so I'll just say 0.Most played games: Crash, Black Jack, Poker & SportsI'd go anon on my wins and losses, I don't even remember most of them tbf. comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: I don't think you should ask for such information publicly and why would even people share this? This information will likely attract the hackers to trick you in the end. Also, this shares people's gambling life which I don't think people should share on an internet forum. I consider this as a private inmformation.Personally, I'm not a big roller and that's what I'm sharing only.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: It seems that the question asked by the OP is really personal and I think that basically here we will see users with negative statistics, people are not inclined to publicly declare their large winnings in online casinos, especially since this information is difficult to verify.Of course, I am also from the group of losers, although I very rarely try to try my luck, but playing in several casinos I just lost ~ $1000.
